page.title: 01THE AREA IN GENERAL
page.content: Situated in Essex,part of a river estuary,a few farms and a small village are the subject of the following nineteen pages.The river is the Blackwater and the village is Goldhanger.Much of this area is farmland with the river estuary also occupying a large part of the area. The buildings are generally fairly old and among the oldest are the church, the old mill,the school,the farmhouses dotted about and the two public houses. The school has several classrooms but is now a study centre. The shore has a variety of animal life such as shore crabs,sand hoppers ect.There are also various grasses and other forms of plant life. There is a sewage works near the sea wall and also several caravan sites.
